poem:
**Block Everything**

In Marseille, the voices rise  
from cobblestone whispers—  
crowds tremble with 30,000  
or maybe 80,000 hopes.  
  
Lyon and Montpellier echo,  
breathing resistance;  
a river of banners  
unfurls against the sky,  
waving anti-capitalist sighs—  
an ocean of feet  
against the cobbled shore.  
  
Protest swells, like blood,  
in the heart of the streets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New French PM takes office as ‘Block Everything’ protests rock country – Europe live 2.50pm BST Tens of thousands of demonstrators gathered for largely peaceful protests in Marseille, Montpellier and Lyon. In Marseille, police estimated the crowd at 8,000, while organisers claimed 30,000 participants and the CGT union reported as many as 80,000, France24 reported. Lyon saw around 8,000 protesters, according to police, while Montpellier saw approximately 6,000. In Montpellier, protesters carried anti-capitalist signs, demanded". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
